definition: to attend school as a day student
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]

sentences.english: Both borders and day students benefit from the cultural diversity of CA's community.
sentences.chinese: 走读生和寄宿生都得益于学校社区的文化多样性。

sentences.english: But for day-boarders, their self-care ability are influenced by many factors.
sentences.chinese: 而走读幼儿的自理能力则受许多因素的影响。

sentences.english: The ordinary day school can' t give much practical training for living.
sentences.chinese: 一般的走读学校不可能提供很多实际的生活锻炼。

sentences.english: The boy is angry, very angry.
On the other hand, the contribution of day schools cannot be ignored.
sentences.chinese: 另一方面，走读学校的贡献也不容忽视。

definition: to attend school on a temporary basis
to go to school/to attend school
junior high school/abbr. for 初級中學|初级中学[chu1 ji2 zhong1 xue2]
to change schools/to transfer to another college
to accompany one's child or spouse who is studying overseas/to help a child with their study, reading or practicing together
